page.title: 01Hamlet of Camps End
page.content: The area is dominated by the isolated All Stains Church with its natural churchyard and earth mounds of the castle moat and deserted village. There is some woodland but the area is mainly arable growing corn, sugar, beat, field beans and rape with a few cattle and pigs. The farms are mainly family units but on the borders of the area are edges of larger units. The fields are medium sized in the main with few hedges. The population is about one hundred. Of those working, most work on the land with others commuting to the local towns, Haverhil, Saffron Walden and Cambridge, or are self employed working from home. There is an animal rescue centre which is mainly for dogs and cats in block 5.
